intro: Senecio septilobus, commonly known as the seven-lobed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a head. Its flowering period usually occurs during the warmer months, and it is adapted to arid conditions. Senecio septilobus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar composite flower structures.
